SE450: Practice (do not hand in): Problem 1 [2/3]

Given the following code fragment for a class MyClass: 

class MyClass extends Observable {
  void someMethod(){
    ... 
    setChanged();
    notifyObservers();
  }
}

and the following main program fragment:

  MyClass o = new MyClass();
  Observer o1 = new Observer() {... some code ...}
  Observer o2 = new Observer() {... some code ...}
  o.addObserver(o1);
  o.addObserver(o2);
  o.someMethod();

draw an object interaction diagram tracing the method executions beginning with the call o.someMethod(). Your diagram should have columns corresponding to objects o, o1, o2, with the leftmost column being o. Do not include any other objects.
